posts.name: Jack R
posts.cooked:
FRC Game Tools 23.1 is out now. Download here.

I am pretty sure this will fix the joystick problems that require a rescan to pick up the HID.

Does anyone have a full changelog available? I can’t seem to find one on the NI site.

posts.name: Rich Jr
posts.cooked: I wish they would buy the .1 somewhere on the site, it’s a bit confusing otherwise.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271

posts.custom_user_title: FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271

posts.name: Carl Hauser
posts.cooked: Is it expected that the NI Package Manager does not detect this as an update? I can download the new installer but usually letting the package manager do updates is faster, if it works.

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked:
YMMV and FWIW, but the first thing the installer did on my machine (which was current before the update) was to update the package manager.

I’m not sure if this version will be required or not, but I plan to advise teams that they strongly consider upgrading if I see the older version during inspection or this comes up in the course of doing the CSA thing.

posts.name: Jesse Knight
posts.cooked: We uninstalled the old version, downloaded the 23.1 installer, and let it reinstall. The driver’s station version still shows up 23.0 on the DS.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: I would double check that you installed the new version and not the kickoff version- the new version definitely has a 23.1 version number on the top border:

posts.name: Waz
posts.cooked: BTW, esp for future readers, you can update to 23.1 without uninstalling 23.0. I think the uninstall is only required between seasons. At least, that is what we did and it is working fine.

posts.name: Jesse Knight
posts.cooked: What does it say on the DS tab that has all of the version info (like RIO image, etc) ?

posts.name: Eric Liefeld
posts.cooked: Does the RoboRIO need to be re-imaged after this update? Or should the image from 23.0 suffice?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: The new image only has relevant changes for LabVIEW teams.  Either image will work fine for C++/Java.

posts.name: ChipBergquist
posts.cooked:
Sorry, this is not a necro. I am trying to set up a Romi. There is not a 2024 version of the Romi WPILIB, only 2023. So I need the 2023 Game Tools. But they seem to no longer be on the NI site.

Download FRC Game Tools and find support information. You can use this download page to access FRC Game Tools and all available editions are available from this download page.

Any ideas on where I can get them?

posts.name: Jeffords
posts.cooked: The NI package manager still has the 2023 game tools listed. You could try downloading them from there.

posts.name: ChipBergquist
posts.cooked:
There you go. Thank you.

Spoke too soon:

posts.name: Jeffords
posts.cooked: This link should download the offline installer for the 2023 tools. Game Tools

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
ChipBergquist:

I am trying to set up a Romi. There is not a 2024 version of the Romi WPILIB, only 2023. So I need the 2023 Game Tools.

The 2023 version of the Romi image will work with 2024 WPILib.  Also, either the 2023 or 2024 versions of the DS interoperate with either 2023 or 2024 versions of WPILib.  The 2024 game tools is only required to get the 2024 RoboRIO image (which is required to use WPILib 2024 on the RoboRIO, but has no effect on Romi use).

posts.name: ChipBergquist
posts.cooked: That does seem to work. But the 2024 Driver Station is not connecting to the Romi. Trying to figure that out now.
